title: Armenian (1733) Mekhitar BIble (WDL-15542)
description: The 1733 Mekhitar Bible, published by Mekhitar Sebastatsi, an Armenian Catholic priest and founder of a Benedictine Armenian Catholic Monastery on San Lazzaro Island in Venice, represents a significant contribution to Armenian religious and cultural heritage. This edition is essentially a revised version of the Oskan Bible, initially printed in 1666 by Oskan Erewants'i in Amsterdam, marking the first complete printing of the Bible in Armenian. The Mekhitar edition, following a reprint in Constantinople in 1705, served as the second reprint of the Oskan Bible, incorporating some editorial adjustments. Notably, this publication is adorned with hand-tipped print illustrations specifically created for this edition. Mekhitar’s work and his establishment of the monastery underscored a longstanding commitment to the education, enlightenment, and spiritual nourishment of the Armenian people. The San Lazzaro Monastery has since evolved into a pivotal center for Armenian learning and publishing, maintaining its influence and relevance into the modern era.
